review_title: The Key shows the potential to VR
one_reviews_text: I absolutely love this experience.    The first time I saw it was at OC6 and it blew me away.   My second time seeing it at home is just as good and works great even without the actor.   I hope more content like this get made and supported.  Projects like the Key shows VR’s potential and will help bring  more people into the platform.

review_title: I highly encourage people to download !
one_reviews_text: It's great to see works like this once in a while.  It changes your perspective for the better, especially in times like these, in where we are constantly running through life and don't notice, we don't pay attention to the things that are truly important.  It has fantastic voice acting !  Very interesting visuals that catch your curiosity, your mind, as you try to figure out what is going on.  You feel like you might have figured out where this is going, but it surprises you.   This experience delivers a very powerful message, and it delivers it very well !

It was much better in the dream world, even if it was hard to follow, still fun because it was odd. They should have just stayed there, moving the story to refugees was, well, just bad story telling. Little floating ball friends, not sure how they relate. Is it a political statement thing?, not sure, but all I see with refugees is what happens when good people do nothing, evil prevails. That is what the true message should have been. People standing in line, not taking action, I don't have much sympathy for that, and I know that is what they were trying to do. The music was excellent, the art was good, but the story went from alright to wow, how is this connected.
This is what VR was meant for. Gripping experience that makes one think.

review_title: Artistic way to show real life feelings
one_reviews_text: It is a nice way to tell a story and in the end kind of brings it all together. It has some minor interactions, but for the most part you just sit and watch the animated action around you. I wouldn’t say it is fully political because war ravaged areas forcing refugees to seek shelter is a real thing. While so many that have never been out of their sheltered life have no idea what it is like. This is more of an artistic way of explaining the feelings of it rather than graphic detail, but touching.
Fun visuals, nice music, worth the download.

Yes, it is FREE - and STILL not worth the price. It has a weird storyline ... made even worse when you learn that is simply a political statement. It would have been lame even without the ending ... the finale made it worse.
If I want to hear the moral posturing and virtue-signaling of leftists, I can turn on CNN. I want a refund!

The Key is a beautiful and moving experience. I have to think those that are disparaging this as something that is simply "pushing a political agenda" are bored children or folks who just expected a game, though it's clearly not advertised as such.

For a long time i thought, why has this won anything ??? and waiting and waiting for something special. Bad grafics, bad controls.
Well at the end i found out.
such a serious topic could be made very interesting, it was first necessary to show the house, then its destruction, then the memories and not such a crazy characters. Complete nonsense. Sorry.

review_title: Not what I I initially expected
one_reviews_text: This experience was amazeing for me non the less, the graphics were amazeing and I love the story built into the game. The only thing I have to complain about this is that it is pretty short, this VR experience is like nothing I've ever seen before and we need content like this in the future.
Frustrating with poor controls built entirely as a way to push a political view point.
wtf was that
Good intentions - surely the reason it won awards. Poor execution, unfortunately. Wanted to be a moving experience but failed. Kudos for trying though.
This was a cool short story and for free too.also i gotta say the house at the very end looks just like the graphics in Xplane 11 with the spray painted windows lol

Which was the point. Great emotional storytelling. Really trippy. Super glad I experienced this.

The people who see the message as nothing but a "political point" have some serious issues.
... pretende una historia con buena intencion, pero es muy aburrido y la musica tan molesta.
Beautiful way to share a powerful message.

First off...it's beautifully done, sad...it's about refugee's. Can't say much about it...it's not a "game" just interesting perspective, arts'y. Worth a quick experience. 3 and a half stars is what i would give it if i could, but since it's a other side of the looking glass perspective i'll give it 4 instead of 3.

This was an interesting little presentation, though I'm not quite sure how suited the 3D characters were for symbolizing the subject at hand (aside from the obvious 'good' and 'bad'). What is The Key? I'm still not sure. Maybe I flat missed it. Still, worth experiencing for the price of admission, and I've no idea what I might have done differently.

Bravo ! une Belle experience ! la VR  est un exellent media et ce genre d animation, c est en plein ce que j attend de la VR. ce laisser porter par une histoire, apprendre et comprendre..... give it a try ;)
Fun and free!
MY BEST EXPERIENCE! THIS IS A MUST HAVE.
history is a sensitive topic. must see.
